GT.content: “we are no longer credulous enough to believe that we are setting out from things themselves by avoiding ‘texts’ simply by avoiding quotation or the appearance of ‘commentary’”
GT.linkedContent: “we are no longer credulous enough to believe that we are setting out from things themselves by avoiding ‘texts’ simply by avoiding quotation or the appearance of ‘commentary’”

GT.content: playing w/ fors, fortuna, ferre (fer, ferre; in Greek, pherô) which means to bear, & fero, “I report,” counterfeit money carries us to heart of question of reference & difference,
GT.linkedContent: playing w/ fors, fortuna, ferre (fer, ferre; in Greek, pherô) which means to bear, & fero, “I report,” counterfeit money carries us to heart of question of reference & difference,

GT.content: dematerialization of money [late capitalism], can one quote money? fors, fortuna: Baudelaire reserves status of absolute exception for money (not the gift)
GT.linkedContent: dematerialization of money [late capitalism], can one quote money? fors, fortuna: Baudelaire reserves status of absolute exception for money (not the gift)

LOBL.content: how could we make a genre work w/out referring to it quotationally?
LOBL.linkedContent: how could we make a genre work w/out referring to it quotationally?

LOBL.content: quotation interrupts very belonging to which it is a necessary condition
LOBL.linkedContent: quotation interrupts very belonging to which it is a necessary condition

LOBL.content: impossible to tell which border forms the other, each comprehends the other by not comprehending the other > which one quotes the other?
LOBL.linkedContent: impossible to tell which border forms the other, each comprehends the other by not comprehending the other > which one quotes the other?

LOBL.content: [extensive description] yes of event, yes of iteration, quotes, cites, in accordance w/ strange ring outside of presence, sur-vives
LOBL.linkedContent: [extensive description] yes of event, yes of iteration, quotes, cites, in accordance w/ strange ring outside of presence, sur-vives

HASD.content: [Derrida, speaking about Meister Eckhart’s apophatic strategies, the aporias of politics of doctrine, also speaks of his own] “the voice of an utterance can conceal another, which it then appears to quote without quoting it, presenting itself as another form, namely as a quotation of the other” [see p. 47]
HASD.linkedContent: [Derrida, speaking about Meister Eckhart’s apophatic strategies, the aporias of politics of doctrine, also speaks of his own] “the voice of an utterance can conceal another, which it then appears to quote without quoting it, presenting itself as another form, namely as a quotation of the other” [see p. 47]

HASD.content: did Dionysus distort or accomplish essence of prayer by quoting it, writing it for Timothy?
HASD.linkedContent: did Dionysus distort or accomplish essence of prayer by quoting it, writing it for Timothy?

HASD.content: most “autobiographical” [attach as many quotation marks around this word as possible] to leave out Jew & Arab, which Derrida has never been able to speak about [see p. 58]
HASD.linkedContent: most “autobiographical” [attach as many quotation marks around this word as possible] to leave out Jew & Arab, which Derrida has never been able to speak about [see p. 58]

MPM.content: fidelity requires that one quote, let other speak, and that one not restrict oneself to quoting > double law of Mnemosyne or common law of double source Mnemosyne/Lethe
MPM.linkedContent: fidelity requires that one quote, let other speak, and that one not restrict oneself to quoting > double law of Mnemosyne or common law of double source Mnemosyne/Lethe

A.content: disquieting phrases need to be sheltered behind paternity [re: “limits of truth” in quotes]
A.linkedContent: disquieting phrases need to be sheltered behind paternity [re: “limits of truth” in quotes]

A.content: quotation marks: name words or names

PP.content: to put word “voluntarily” in quotation marks designates, content to remain within the closure of oppositions, “submission” to the necessities of a given “language”
PP.linkedContent: to put word “voluntarily” in quotation marks designates, content to remain within the closure of oppositions, “submission” to the necessities of a given “language”

OH.content: paleonyms: “identity,” “culture,” “Europe,” “capital” > take them very seriously, cautiously, lightly, only in quotation marks
OH.linkedContent: paleonyms: “identity,” “culture,” “Europe,” “capital” > take them very seriously, cautiously, lightly, only in quotation marks

S.content: putting “spirit” in quotation marks preserves and withdraws something of Latin-Cartesian meaning
S.linkedContent: putting “spirit” in quotation marks preserves and withdraws something of Latin-Cartesian meaning

S.content: Heidegger’s doubling of “spirit” by use of quotation marks affects it w/ obsessive specter, he doesn’t shelter “spirit,” a hospitality w/ reservations, quotations call for another word unless they re-call the other under the same
S.linkedContent: Heidegger’s doubling of “spirit” by use of quotation marks affects it w/ obsessive specter, he doesn’t shelter “spirit,” a hospitality w/ reservations, quotations call for another word unless they re-call the other under the same

S.content: beautiful description of the guard-like theatrical nature of quotation marks, and when they are relieved from “Geist” has spirit itself or spirit’s ghost (spectre) come on stage?
S.linkedContent: beautiful description of the guard-like theatrical nature of quotation marks, and when they are relieved from “Geist” has spirit itself or spirit’s ghost (spectre) come on stage?

S.content: silent play of quotation marks [re: spirit], Anführungsstriche, Anführungszeichen, “the hand calculates very fast,” Anführen, to conduct, dupe, brainwash, silent contrivances, fort/da, what shows or hides changes everything, and when one puts away after exhibiting, this is mise au pas (bringing to heel)
S.linkedContent: silent play of quotation marks [re: spirit], Anführungsstriche, Anführungszeichen, “the hand calculates very fast,” Anführen, to conduct, dupe, brainwash, silent contrivances, fort/da, what shows or hides changes everything, and when one puts away after exhibiting, this is mise au pas (bringing to heel)

S.content: Derrida stresses theater of Heidegger’s removal (w/out remarking) of quotation marks from “spirit”
S.linkedContent: Derrida stresses theater of Heidegger’s removal (w/out remarking) of quotation marks from “spirit”

S.content: [re: Gespräch btwn Heidegger & Trakl] the circle via death, via decline, via West that returns to most originary not analogous to circles/revolutions in Marx and Hegel, so “circle, decline, West,” in Heidegger, are paleonyms, receive quotation marks to lead us elsewhere
S.linkedContent: [re: Gespräch btwn Heidegger & Trakl] the circle via death, via decline, via West that returns to most originary not analogous to circles/revolutions in Marx and Hegel, so “circle, decline, West,” in Heidegger, are paleonyms, receive quotation marks to lead us elsewhere

POOF.content: Nietzsche puts “truth” in quotation marks, certain type of democrat would never dare to
POOF.linkedContent: Nietzsche puts “truth” in quotation marks, certain type of democrat would never dare to

DS.content: [re: one of Mallarmé’s sentences] sentence in quotation marks is a simulacrum of a citation, an illustrious rule, a law of unknown origin
DS.linkedContent: [re: one of Mallarmé’s sentences] sentence in quotation marks is a simulacrum of a citation, an illustrious rule, a law of unknown origin

DS.content: [re: Mallarmé] to write the word insertion (to place w/in, to graft) is to quote the practice of spacing (same goes for writing antre ouvert)
DS.linkedContent: [re: Mallarmé] to write the word insertion (to place w/in, to graft) is to quote the practice of spacing (same goes for writing antre ouvert)

DS.content: to write that such a movement [practice of spacing, antre ouvert, insertion] plays along a structure of supplementarity, surplus, vicariousness, is, literally, to quote
DS.linkedContent: to write that such a movement [practice of spacing, antre ouvert, insertion] plays along a structure of supplementarity, surplus, vicariousness, is, literally, to quote

ROP.content: when Foucault puts “sexuality” in quotation marks, we’re thus dealing w/ history of the word
ROP.linkedContent: when Foucault puts “sexuality” in quotation marks, we’re thus dealing w/ history of the word

SP.content: divergence w/in truth elevated in quotation marks > the machination, cry, flight and pinch of a hooker (machination, cri, vol et pinces d’une grue) [grue: hooker or crane]
SP.linkedContent: divergence w/in truth elevated in quotation marks > the machination, cry, flight and pinch of a hooker (machination, cri, vol et pinces d’une grue) [grue: hooker or crane]

ATIA.content: every response to “who am I?” is only something I can answer, auto-biography, but it’s also quotation, an aping, miming [idiom & inheritance]
ATIA.linkedContent: every response to “who am I?” is only something I can answer, auto-biography, but it’s also quotation, an aping, miming [idiom & inheritance]

O.content: paleonymy (keep old word for determined time?): question goes beyond signifier’s simple exteriority to its concept, beyond a fore-knowledge of paleonymic strategy: escape or destroy word in question (i.e. “literature,” “philosophical discourse”) [?]
O.linkedContent: paleonymy (keep old word for determined time?): question goes beyond signifier’s simple exteriority to its concept, beyond a fore-knowledge of paleonymic strategy: escape or destroy word in question (i.e. “literature,” “philosophical discourse”) [?]

TB.content: translation: task of pure limit, an infinite labor to rejoin (doesn’t exclude gradations, virtuality, interval & in-btwn) > can one quote a signature?
TB.linkedContent: translation: task of pure limit, an infinite labor to rejoin (doesn’t exclude gradations, virtuality, interval & in-btwn) > can one quote a signature?

DPi.content: Derrida violently extracts a quote (w/out attributing it)—to theatricalize: so as to let you see and hear it [re: “to espouse at the cost of his or her life”]
DPi.linkedContent: Derrida violently extracts a quote (w/out attributing it)—to theatricalize: so as to let you see and hear it [re: “to espouse at the cost of his or her life”]

Gi.content: “sexuality” mentioned not used when in quotations: quotation marks as a warning, an accusation
Gi.linkedContent: “sexuality” mentioned not used when in quotations: quotation marks as a warning, an accusation

Gi.content: put in quotes because it is as much about the name as what it names [“Geschlecht”]
Gi.linkedContent: put in quotes because it is as much about the name as what it names [“Geschlecht”]

DST.content: quotation marks: vigilant circumspection, insurance against all risks [in this case Lacoue-Labarthe continually exposes himself to these risks]
DST.linkedContent: quotation marks: vigilant circumspection, insurance against all risks [in this case Lacoue-Labarthe continually exposes himself to these risks]

PIO.content: inventive event as both quotation & narrative [re: “Fable”], allegory & tautegory > event of an utterance, its vis inventiva, inseparable from syntactic play, also an art of disposition
PIO.linkedContent: inventive event as both quotation & narrative [re: “Fable”], allegory & tautegory > event of an utterance, its vis inventiva, inseparable from syntactic play, also an art of disposition

PF.content: quotations, suspend word [“United States”] in epokhē of epoch, a fabulous act of nomination, fabula (like provocation) recounts/deciphers a history, the phantasm of an accredited myth, myth by force of law, “enforced” myth
PF.linkedContent: quotations, suspend word [“United States”] in epokhē of epoch, a fabulous act of nomination, fabula (like provocation) recounts/deciphers a history, the phantasm of an accredited myth, myth by force of law, “enforced” myth

TR.content: quotation marks as performativity, instituting new concept/contract w/ word

PJP.content: the suspension of metonymy, quotation, interruption, quasi anacoluthic change of subject > interruption in the obvious: shadow at heart of light
PJP.linkedContent: the suspension of metonymy, quotation, interruption, quasi anacoluthic change of subject > interruption in the obvious: shadow at heart of light

PJP.content: when narrator claims to be quoting: makes the other say
PJP.linkedContent: when narrator claims to be quoting: makes the other say

D.content: before being milieu of work/production, as a breakthrough, air is “air”: a “quotation,” empty medium of text as generalized quotation
D.linkedContent: before being milieu of work/production, as a breakthrough, air is “air”: a “quotation,” empty medium of text as generalized quotation

EL.content: “logic,” “program,” “nihilism” in quotation marks—give these words a gripping resemblance to their opposite
EL.linkedContent: “logic,” “program,” “nihilism” in quotation marks—give these words a gripping resemblance to their opposite

+R.content: quotation [Adami] cut out of Glas: outbidding speculating to infinity
+R.linkedContent: quotation [Adami] cut out of Glas: outbidding speculating to infinity

LI.content: “concept” of remainder not a sure thing (de tout repos), concept in quotes because remainder deconstructs the logic upon which the concept of the “concept” depends
LI.linkedContent: “concept” of remainder not a sure thing (de tout repos), concept in quotes because remainder deconstructs the logic upon which the concept of the “concept” depends

TN.content: one must always, as a duty, imperative, reconstitute the ample, tight webbing (le tissu ample et serré) of a quotation—though it’s impossible
TN.linkedContent: one must always, as a duty, imperative, reconstitute the ample, tight webbing (le tissu ample et serré) of a quotation—though it’s impossible

TN.content: [re: Nancy quote] violently excerpted: reread everything around it [few pages later: need to read on]
TN.linkedContent: [re: Nancy quote] violently excerpted: reread everything around it [few pages later: need to read on]

TN.content: quotation marks (guillemets): touching word as if w/ tweezers (pincettes), as if it were contaminated in advance > “touch”
TN.linkedContent: quotation marks (guillemets): touching word as if w/ tweezers (pincettes), as if it were contaminated in advance > “touch”

ATM.content: re: Levinas, “astriction to giving” complicates quoted utterance “here I am,” what is said only once, what exceeds not the saying but the said in language
ATM.linkedContent: re: Levinas, “astriction to giving” complicates quoted utterance “here I am,” what is said only once, what exceeds not the saying but the said in language

ATM.content: [vis-à-vis Levinas] interdictory language is interdicted but continues speaking, can’t help itself, can only continue strangely interrupting itself > essential function of a quotation: quoting the uncitable accuses language, (sur)rendered to a gift language can’t open up on its own
ATM.linkedContent: [vis-à-vis Levinas] interdictory language is interdicted but continues speaking, can’t help itself, can only continue strangely interrupting itself > essential function of a quotation: quoting the uncitable accuses language, (sur)rendered to a gift language can’t open up on its own

ATM.content: how to cite when Levinas places the whole language (French & Western) btwn quotation marks? at same time “he” is in quotation marks: the nameless signatory w/out authorial signature, “he” who undersigns every work, met en oeuvre tout ouvrage
ATM.linkedContent: how to cite when Levinas places the whole language (French & Western) btwn quotation marks? at same time “he” is in quotation marks: the nameless signatory w/out authorial signature, “he” who undersigns every work, met en oeuvre tout ouvrage

ATM.content: [Levinas’ work] a fabrication of quotation marks crocheting a text w/out edge (bordure): seriality irreducibly knots a text to a language
ATM.linkedContent: [Levinas’ work] a fabrication of quotation marks crocheting a text w/out edge (bordure): seriality irreducibly knots a text to a language

ATM.content: infinite law of quotation marks suspends all reference, work enclosed in a borderless context it gives to itself (se donne à elle-même), while making absolute reference to command of tout autre
ATM.linkedContent: infinite law of quotation marks suspends all reference, work enclosed in a borderless context it gives to itself (se donne à elle-même), while making absolute reference to command of tout autre

WOG.content: quotation marks around “Greeks,” “me,” “we others,” around every autos, something other than playful coquettishness or simulacrum of signature
WOG.linkedContent: quotation marks around “Greeks,” “me,” “we others,” around every autos, something other than playful coquettishness or simulacrum of signature

ATAP.content: quoting title, a genre, genre making fun of a genre [re: Kant’s “Of an Overlordly Tone Recently Adopted in Philosophy”]
ATAP.linkedContent: quoting title, a genre, genre making fun of a genre [re: Kant’s “Of an Overlordly Tone Recently Adopted in Philosophy”]

ATAP.content: John Patmos’ double bind: “do not seal the words of the inspiration of this book” > must disobey in order to obey: problem of translation re: quotation marks (“I, Yéshoua”)
ATAP.linkedContent: John Patmos’ double bind: “do not seal the words of the inspiration of this book” > must disobey in order to obey: problem of translation re: quotation marks (“I, Yéshoua”)

CIR.content: G.’s countersigning attestation, daring to kill the quotation marks, w/out quoting me, calling me back to a moment when I didn’t yet know what circumcision means [?]
CIR.linkedContent: G.’s countersigning attestation, daring to kill the quotation marks, w/out quoting me, calling me back to a moment when I didn’t yet know what circumcision means [?]

CIR.content: intolerable foreclosure when I write: the already known, loved, that can’t be quoted; gather myself in circle of cum, circus of circum, before the constituting witness I’m always fleeing
CIR.linkedContent: intolerable foreclosure when I write: the already known, loved, that can’t be quoted; gather myself in circle of cum, circus of circum, before the constituting witness I’m always fleeing

CIR.content: pronounce an atrociously tragic sentence, make its quotation marks appear, abandoning it to anonymity, putting forward an analysis > for more drama, who more than the other is vulnerable to analysis?
CIR.linkedContent: pronounce an atrociously tragic sentence, make its quotation marks appear, abandoning it to anonymity, putting forward an analysis > for more drama, who more than the other is vulnerable to analysis?

FV.content: signer dispossessed [re: The Purloined…], signature in quotations: ce reste est encore de la littérature
FV.linkedContent: signer dispossessed [re: The Purloined…], signature in quotations: ce reste est encore de la littérature
